intro: Lampocarya setifolia, commonly known as the slender-fruited lampocarya, is a species of flowering plant in the family Polygonaceae. It is native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico, where it typically grows in arid or semi-arid environments. The plant is characterized by its upright stems and small, clustered greenish-white flowers. Its leaves are lance-shaped and often covered in fine hairs, which help reduce water loss in its dry habitat. Lampocarya setifolia produces small, elongated fruits that contain a single seed, contributing to its ecological role in local ecosystems.
